text: Zeta Ursae Minoris (ζ UMi, ζ Ursae Minoris) is a star in the constellation Ursa Minor. It is a white stellar class A-type main sequence star with an apparent magnitude of +4.28. It is approximately 380 light years from Earth. Despite its classification as a main sequence dwarf star, Zeta UMi is 3.4 times the mass of the sun and its luminosity is about 200 solar luminosities. At a surface temperature of 8,700 kelvins, this star is actually on the verge of becoming a giant star. Zeta UMi may also be a variable of the Delta Scuti type. In some Arabic star charts it is listed as أخفى الفرقدين ʼakhfā al- farqadayn, meaning "the dimmer of the two calves", and paired with η Ursae Minoris as ʼanwar al-farqadayn, "the brighter of the two calves". The names may originally refer to a pair of Ibexes, and are more properly applied to γ UMi and β UMi respectively, the brighter two stars in the rectangle of Ursa Minor. ==References== Ursae Minoris, Zeta Category:Ursa Minor (constellation) Category:A-type main-sequence stars Ursae Minoris, 16 077055 5903 142105 Category:Durchmusterung objects
title: Zeta Ursae Minoris
